We recently stayed at the Mercure Bandung City Centre, and as the name suggests, the location is really convenient. It made it super easy for us to get around and explore the city, whether we were walking or driving. We booked a Privilege room, and while it was clean and had all the amenities we needed, it did feel a little smaller than it looked in the pictures. The complete set of amenities was a nice touch, and I was especially impressed with the quality of the soap, shampoo, and conditioner. I'm a Gold member with their loyalty program, and while I was hoping for a room upgrade, the hotel was fully booked. The staff were very understanding and nicely offered a free breakfast to compensate, which was a great gesture. The breakfast itself was a highlight of our stay. The restaurant had a ton of different sections, from a station where you could get Indomie and congee to a variety of cakes, fresh fruits, and other local dishes. It was a really fun way to start the day with so many options to choose from. The hotel also has a rooftop pool and a small gym, which are nice to have. The only small hiccup was during check-in. A staff member had texted me earlier saying we could check in at 1 PM, but when we got there, our room wasn't ready and we had to wait for more than half an hour. It wasn't a huge deal, but it was a bit of a letdown after being told we could check in early. All in all, it was a good stay, and the hotel's location and breakfast definitely made up for the minor issues.

We stayed for two nights and booked a Classic room. The check-in process was simple and quick, and the receptionists were so friendly. They assigned us a room on the 9th level. Interior-wise, the room reflected a chic combination of Mid-century modern and Art Deco, with a little Steampunk-ish touch (the wall lamp above the desk looks like a series of monocles for us). The bed was pretty comfortable and big enough for two person. Initially, we doubted the comfort of the chair but turned out, it was so comfortable. The bathroom was rather small and adjusting the right temperature was kind of difficult as turning the tap slightly too much would result in the water being either too cold or too hot. The closet needed improvement as the doors couldn't be closed properly. However, the overall room condition was great, especially with a nice city view. The breakfast was okay. The menu varied, but not that greatly. The property had a designated smoking area--a spacious balcony--in the restaurant. The restaurant itself was quite spacious and stylish. However, our favourite part of the stay was the pool. The infinity pool overlooked the city, which was great. The water wasn't heated and the whirlpool didn't work (this was kind of disappointing) but the view really amused us, especially when swimming in the afternoon. Next to the pool was a gym. The gym was pretty small, with a limited number of equipments but had the same city view which made exercising more interesting. Location-wise, the property allows us to access the city centre easily. There are a number of restaurants, cafes, and convenience stores nearby the premises. The only thing we hated was the parking lot. The number of parking spaces available for a hotel with 170 rooms was too limited, and we almost didn't have a space to park our car. However, the overall staying experience was pleasant. Staff members were also helpful, friendly, and courteous. We'd love to stay again at Mercure Bandung City Centre.
